intro: Psoralea conferta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, compound leaves. The plant produces yellow or pale green flowers arranged in racemes, which are typically borne on the upper parts of the stems. Psoralea conferta is often found in sandy or gravelly soils in arid or semi-arid regions. It is a small shrub or perennial herb, typically growing to a height of 10–30 centimeters.
